Weather outlook: More rain on the way for NZ after settled start to the week https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/weather-outlook-more-rain-on-way-for-nz-after-settled-start-to-the-week/5KSYO7IMMRBSTECQGZ2FHCTL3I/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/weather-outlook-more-rain-on-way-for-nz-after-settled-start-to-the-week/5KSYO7IMMRBSTECQGZ2FHCTL3I/ Jamie MortonMore balmy weather is forecast to kick off the working week – but it won't last for long. Sun, 17 Nov 2024 07:35:17 +0000 There’s more warm weather in store for Monday – but that’s forecast to give way to a series of fronts, bringing rain to most places by Thursday. Photo / Alex Burton
Marokopa fugitive father Tom Phillips: Former police inspector wants to negotiate end to family’s three-year disappearance https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/marokopa-fugitive-father-tom-phillips-former-police-inspector-wants-to-negotiate-end-to-familys-third-year-disappearance/YOQ365HXJVE4RCH2N4IYUMQ56Q/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/marokopa-fugitive-father-tom-phillips-former-police-inspector-wants-to-negotiate-end-to-familys-third-year-disappearance/YOQ365HXJVE4RCH2N4IYUMQ56Q/ The father and his three children were spotted in the Marokopa bush last month. Sun, 17 Nov 2024 07:17:06 +0000 Police are searching for Tom Phillips and his three children Ember, Maverick, and Jayda, who have been missing from Marokopa since December 2021. Photo / NZME
Police expecting up to 30,000 people on the hīkoi mō te Tiriti when it arrives at Parliament on Tuesday https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-expecting-up-to-30000-people-on-the-hikoi-mo-te-tiriti-when-it-arrives-at-parliament-on-星期二/NQC2EGONWVG5JFVBQWYWGOE7HQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-expecting-up-to-30000-people-on-the-hikoi-mo-te-tiriti-when-it-arrives-at-parliament-on-星期二/NQC2EGONWVG5JFVBQWYWGOE7HQ/ Bernard OrsmanThe hīkoi is expected to be on the scale of the seabed and foreshore hīkoi 20 years ago. Sun, 17 Nov 2024 06:18:46 +0000 Te Pāti Māori co-leader Rawiri Waititi at the hīkoi mō te Tiriti on Rotorua’s Fenton St on Friday. Photo / Ben Fraser
Junk food fail: Just how unhealthy are New Zealand’s school tuck shops? https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/junk-food-fail-just-how-unhealthy-are-nzs-school-tuck-shops/CYFNHC4FJRGKZJMTQG374TDSC4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/junk-food-fail-just-how-unhealthy-are-nzs-school-tuck-shops/CYFNHC4FJRGKZJMTQG374TDSC4/ Jamie MortonOur intermediate and secondary schools have received a fail grade for healthy menus. Sun, 17 Nov 2024 06:00:00 +0000 Junk foods like soft drinks, lollies and sausage rolls have been found to dominate healthier options in New Zealand’s school tuck shops, with just a tiny fraction of those surveyed meeting nutrition guidelines. Photo / Bay of Plenty Times

Police renew call for help finding missing man Graham Russell Smith https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-renew-call-for-help-finding-missing-man-graham-russell-smith/S7YZ6ZF75NHZ5JZWG6RHP7ZOC4/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/police-renew-call-for-help-finding-missing-man-graham-russell-smith/S7YZ6ZF75NHZ5JZWG6RHP7ZOC4/ Graham Russell Smith has been missing for a week. Sun, 17 Nov 2024 05:44:19 +0000 Police have released a new photo of missing Porirua man Graham Russell Smith who was reported missing on the evening of Sunday 10 November, after going for a walk on Doctor Track on the Rangituhi/Colonial Knob walkway. Photo / Supplied

New footage of Auckland prison inmate’s popular TikTok videos emerges after account shut down https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/new-footage-of-auckland-prison-inmates-popular-tiktok-videos-emerges-after-account-shut-down/TUCXXWLCFFBPHITFWDWG67VOWQ/ https://www.nzherald.co.nz/nz/new-footage-of-auckland-prison-inmates-popular-tiktok-videos-emerges-after-account-shut-down/TUCXXWLCFFBPHITFWDWG67VOWQ/ One video from inside the high-security prison gained 100,000 views in less than a day.
